page.title: 13ICI FARM AT WIMBOLDSLEY
page.content: ICI bought the farm from J.Verdin in 1934 for the salt.The 3 farms, Dairy house, Lea Head, Lea Hall (400 acres) hold 320 cows,make 10000 tonnes of grass a year and employ 6 men.Each cow can give 5000litres a year.In 1880 J.Verdin had 140 cows, employing 30. {MACHINES }used are 7tractors,1 loader, a 24 cow milking parlour,mowers and forage harvesters. ICI used to make Cheshire cheese.It is a demonstration farm to show farmers and salesmen how to use ICI fertiliser silage additives,weedkillers,fungicide and pesticide which controls fritfly. {GRASSES }grown are short term (cut continuously for silage and sown every 2/3years) and long term (cutting /grazing, sown every 5/8years).Cutting only is done on fields across the road where car accidents break hedges and traffic is a danger to cows.
